intro: Ehretia bourreria, commonly known as the velvet tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and lance-shaped leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by spherical fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a shade tree.
